articles.title: Europe's energy crisis: Will Africa ride to the rescue? - African Business
articles.description: Geography puts Africa in a prime position to increase energy exports to Europe, but what needs to be done to capitalise on the opportunities?
articles.content:
In the grim weeks since Vladimir Putin launched his war against Ukraine, Europe has finally woken up to the reality that it needs to kick its addiction to Russian fossil fuels and fast.

articles.title: UK set for hottest day of 2022 so far as temperatures to hit 26C - The Guardian
articles.description: Met Office predicts spells of sunshine across country as plume of warm air arrives from Europe
articles.content: The UKs hottest day of the year so far is expected on Tuesday, with spells of sunshine across the country and temperatures forecast to rise to 26 degrees in London offering an early glimpse of summer… [+1859 chars]

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Could Finland and Sweden's bid to join NATO spell the end of 'neutral' European countries? - ABC News
articles.description: Finland and Sweden's announcement that they intend to join NATO has dashed Vladimir Putin's hopes his war in Ukraine would deter expansion of the military alliance. But could it also mark the end of neutral states in Europe?
articles.content:
Finland and Sweden have announced they intend to join the NATO military alliance, a major shift away from their policy of military non-alignment. 
Security concerns over Russia's invasion of Ukraine… [+6708 chars]

articles.title: Peek-a-boo! This is how Super Flower Blood Moon eclipse looked from space - India Today
articles.description: In a series of photographs released by the European Space Agency, the Moon can be seen playing hide and seek with one of the International Space Station's solar panels.

articles.author: Natalia Zinets
articles.title: More than 250 Ukrainian troops surrender as Kyiv orders Mariupol to yield - The Star Online
articles.description: KYIV/NOVOAZOVSK, Ukraine (Reuters) -More than 250 Ukrainian fighters surrendered to Russian forces at the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol and Kyiv said it had ordered its entire garrison to evacuate, heralding the end of Europe's bloodiest battle in decades.
